Description: Painted sycomore fig wood shabti of Nebiun with a blue lappet wig, a carved brown face with the features traced in black, a red, yellow black and blue collar, brown hands in relief holding two black hoes, the body is painted white, the legs are inscribed with a central column of black painted hieroglyphs on a yellow ground with a red border, the feet are red, the back is decorated with representations of two red seed-bags hanging from either shoulder.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
